channel.title: BBC News

item.title: Power being restored after disruption caused by Storm Chandra
item.description: Warnings for heavy rain, flooding and strong winds have been issued across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Man shot twice in north Belfast attack
item.description: The man, aged in his 30s, is said to have been shot once in each leg.

item.title: Talks with independent care workers paused since pay deal 'U-turn'
item.description: A pay offer for doctors, nurses, and auxiliary staff does not include care workers in the independent sector.

item.title: NI to become first in the UK to introduce graduated driving licences
item.description: The new rules will be introduced in October and are described as the most significant reform of driver licensing for 70 years.

item.title: Children 'traumatised and screaming' after sectarian attack
item.description: Windows were smashed and the front door of a house in the Waterside was daubed with paint on Monday.

item.title: Major character set to return for season four of Blue Lights
item.description: The BBC announced its plans for the new series, which will see another six episodes.

item.title: 'I was texting, ringing but she didn't reply': The families left behind after a road death
item.description: 56 lives were lost on Northern Ireland's roads in 2025.

item.title: 'My career was saving lives on the roads - and then I lost my brother in a crash'
item.description: BBC News NI speaks to some first responders about the affect road traffic collisions have on them.

item.title: Noah Donohoe inquest shown CCTV footage on day he disappeared
item.description: Footage shows the teenager leaving his home at Fitzroy Avenue and cycling down the street and onwards to the main road.

item.title: Former NI-born MP charged with sexual assault
item.description: McGinn served as MP for St Helens North from 2015 but was suspended by the Labour Party in 2022.

item.title: Nama fraud prosecution 'utterly hopeless', says defence
item.description: Frank Cushnahan has been on trial since September in relation to his role as an adviser to the National Asset Management Agency, known as Nama.

item.title: Jessie Buckley and Paul Mescal among Bafta nominees
item.description: The political thriller has 14 nominations, with Sinners, Hamnet and Marty Supreme also recognised.

item.title: Traitors winner Rachel Duffy 'heartbroken' following mum's death
item.description: Writing on Instagram, Rachel Duffy said she was "heartbroken" at the death of her "beautiful wee mummy".

item.title: Why the price of car insurance continues to soar
item.description: Figures show Northern Ireland is the most expensive region in the UK for younger drivers, outside London.

item.title: Civil Service staffing challenges 'escalated' since 2020 report
item.description: The Auditor General raised concerns about the "affordability" of filling the vacant posts and the "reliability" of workforce data.

item.title: Jail for 'brutal, cold-blooded' man who killed sister and set home on fire
item.description: Kornelijus Bracas, 27, will serve at least 24 years, with the judge saying he had demonstrated gratuitous violence" in murdering Alexia Nazarova.

item.title: Natalie McNally murder trial to go ahead despite barristers' strike
item.description: Natalie, 32, was 15 weeks pregnant when she was killed at her home in Lurgan in December 2022.

item.title: Man arrested in National Crime Agency human trafficking probe
item.description: The Afghan national was detained on suspicion of facilitating illegal immigration at a property in Balornock, Glasgow.

item.title: Traffic caused by £3.2m roadworks a 'big loss' for businesses
item.description: An Eglinton businesswoman has said the construction of a cycle path that "many feel will never be used" is costing her and other local businesses valuable customers.

item.title: Irish and Iraqi artists build bonds through shared musical journey
item.description: The eight-piece ensemble connects musicians from Londonderry's North West Folk Collective with artists from Iraq's Mshakht Collective.

item.title: 'Huge honour' as Rhys McClenaghan gets freedom of the borough
item.description: McClenaghan, from Newtownards, made history after winning Ireland's first gold medal in gymnastics at the Paris Olympics 2024.

item.title: With demolition due to start, what's next for Casement Park?
item.description: Demolition work is due to take 12 weeks, and then all eyes will be on the GAA to see their next steps.

item.title: Celebrating Burns Night: Why it matters in Northern Ireland
item.description: Burns Night is celebrated throughout the world, but has particular relevance in Northern Ireland.

item.title: 'Intertwined histories' to be celebrated in USA's 250th birthday year
item.description: Local groups are planning to celebrate the USA's 250th birthday and its Ulster-Scots links.

item.title: 'I have to go home and tell my children it's not nice to lie'
item.description: From poker faces to genuine shock, Rachel's game face was on par to get her through some serious heat amongst fellow competitors.

item.title: 'It would be a shame to lose this special place'
item.description: An operator is sought to take over a free community hub but users are anxious about the change.

item.title: Murder and MI5: How an extraordinary battle erupted over what the state keeps secret
item.description: Can the state, especially when it is implicated in killing, be trusted as the arbiter of what should remain confidential?

item.title: 'My tooth gap feels like a goalpost - but I can't get an NHS dentist'
item.description: Joe Friel has tried and failed over a four-month period to find a dentist to treat him under the NHS.

item.title: Is Rachel one of the greatest Traitors ever?
item.description: She was cool, calm and collected in the castle and even her opponents say that she "played a blinder".

item.title: Hometown cheers and tension as family find out Rachel's Traitors fate
item.description: Rachel Duffy's family and friends gathered in her home town as the fourth series of the hit BBC show came to a climactic end.

item.title: Bad taste or a new way to educate? The proposed Troubles game explained
item.description: A game, which focuses on The Troubles, has received push back from victims' groups but developers brand it "educational".

item.title: The natural surprise behind Mount Stewart's 'ghost ponds'
item.description: Ghost ponds across Mount Stewart are halting the decline of some species and bringing others back

item.title: 'Very distressing' to suspend emotional support classes - principal
item.description: Some schools have had to cancel classes designed to help young children with social needs due to a lack of funding.

item.title: BBC Newsline signed summary
item.description: A signed summary of BBC Newsline.

item.title: Ulster Folk Museum to be 'reawakened' with £50m investment
item.description: The 62-year-old visitor attraction is to be reawakened and reimagined with a significant investment.

item.title: 'My cancer prognosis was so good because I was seen quickly'
item.description: Cancer Research UK warns that emergency measures to tackle NI's cancer diagnosis backlog must be introduced.

item.title: Have your say in a fresh plan to aid the recovery of nature
item.description: Northern Ireland is one of the most nature-depleted areas in the world - what can be done to reverse the decline?

item.title: 'I don't want anyone else to die by suicide'
item.description: Nisra figures confirm that 290 deaths by suicide were registered in Northern Ireland in 2024.

item.title: Fifteen cars have tyres slashed near school
item.description: The attack happened in a carpark in the Glenview Drive area of Limavady on Monday morning.

item.title: Traffic caused by £3.2m roadworks a 'big loss' for businesses
item.description: An Eglinton businesswoman has said the construction of a cycle path that "many feel will never be used" is costing her and other local businesses valuable customers.

item.title: Man, 19, charged with arson after house fire
item.description: The fire happened in Crannog Way, Dungannon. No one was in the house or injured.

item.title: 'My tooth gap feels like a goalpost - but I can't get an NHS dentist'
item.description: Joe Friel has tried and failed over a four-month period to find a dentist to treat him under the NHS.

item.title: Man died on M1 after 'physical altercation' on hard shoulder
item.description: The results of an inquest into the death of Darryl Thompson from Beragh have been released at Laganside Courts in Belfast.

item.title: Shop delighted as families 'Say Yes to the Dress' for First Communions
item.description: The event was held after a donation of 14 First Communion dresses from a primary school in Londonderry.

item.title: 'High rates and lack of customers' bring shutters down on shops
item.description: Business owners in Strabane say the growth of online shopping and rising operating costs, has left many struggling.

item.title: Man sentenced for putting father's body in fridge
item.description: John Garrett O'Sullivan, 56, admitted preventing the lawful burial of his father, a retired orthodontist.

item.title: Victim's daughter distressed by killer's confessions in BBC documentary
item.description: Lauren Bradford-Clarke's mother Lesley Howell was one of two people murdered by Colin Howell and his former lover.

item.title: James McClean's family 'close door on abuse' as they move home
item.description: Eric McClean says the move will allow them to "close the door" on the abuse they suffered for James's refusal to wear a poppy.

item.title: More than 300 jobs at risk at food packing facility
item.description: Linden Foods processes and manufactures beef, lamb, pork and chicken for branded and own label products.

item.title: Murder victim died from blunt force trauma, court told
item.description: Wayne John Reid, 43, was found dead at house in Society Court in the town on 12 January.

item.title: Boy, 17, appears in court over serious assault
item.description: The court was told that a second boy had suffered a bleed to the brain after a one-punch assault in Londonderry.

item.title: 'I put off my smear test for so long out of stupidity'
item.description: Diona Doherty shared her experience of undergoing treatment for severe pre-cancerous cells after years of putting off getting a smear test.

item.title: How football fanatic's 'dream came true' with club role
item.description: Jonathan Fillis is one of 700 people who have been placed in various roles by the Northern Trust's Day Opportunities programme.

item.title: About 30 jobs at risk as SuperValu set to close
item.description: The SuperValu store, in the Shantallow area of Derry, is to close at the end of March.

item.title: Man continued to work on farm for five hours after heart attack
item.description: Robert Nevin woke in the middle of the night in February 2024 with what he believed was indigestion, but it was a heart attack.

item.title: Focus on Derry student accommodation as Magee project enters 'critical phase'
item.description: The Magee taskforce says they are entering a "critical phase" in delivering the target of 10,000 students.

item.title: Boy, 17, sustains serious head injury in assault
item.description: The teenager was found "unconscious on the ground" after CCTV operators reported an altercation to police.

item.title: Teenage girl dies in Dublin after being hit by scrambler
item.description: A teenage boy has been arrested and remains in custody following the incident on Ratoath Road, Finglas.

item.title: Bluetongue virus in Wexford herd and suspected case in Portavogie
item.description: The cattle in county Wexford is the latest confirmed case of the virus.

item.title: 'Saipan was not a jolly' - the infamous Keane v McCarthy row
item.description: Former Republic of Ireland keeper Dean Kiely reveals what happened during Roy Keane and Mick McCarthy's infamous row before the 2002 World Cup.

item.title: Father 'haunted' that son's body lay in morgue for over a year
item.description: The remains of James 'Jim' O'Neill, 43, from Belfast, were discovered in Phoenix Park in Dublin in November 2023.

item.title: Fisherman dies on Spanish vessel off Irish coast
item.description: The alarm was raised after 09:00 local time after the Irish Coast Guard received a call from Spanish counterparts.

item.title: Workers recover 15,000 crabs after lorry crashes into field
item.description: Thousands of crabs bound for Portugal spilled out of containers after the crash in Redcastle, County Donegal, on Monday.

item.title: Ceremony to accredit Iran's Irish ambassador postponed
item.description: Thousands of people are believed to be dead following massive anti-government protests in Iran.

item.title: Almost 13,000 Irish passports to be re-issued
item.description: In a statement, the Irish Department of Foreign Affairs said the Passport Service "sincerely regrets" the issue.

item.title: US sighting of rare whale first recorded off Donegal 'extraordinary'
item.description: North Atlantic right whales are among the planet's most critically endangered large ocean mammals.

item.title: Irish PM calls for 'common sense' on Greenland
item.description: On Tuesday the White House said the "US military is always an option" to achieve President Donald Trump's goal of taking over the semi-autonomous region.

item.title: Man in court charged with murder of Donegal businessman
item.description: Stephen McCahill's body was found at a house near Ardara, County Donegal, in the early hours of Monday.

item.title: Four released from hospital after arson attack
item.description: A woman in her 40s who sustained serious injuries is the only one of five victims still in hospital.

item.title: New discovery may challenge theory Vikings built first Irish towns - researcher
item.description: Dr Dirk Brandherm and his colleagues have identified more than 600 suspected house platforms in the Brusselstown Ring.

item.title: Gardaí release getaway car details in murder inquiry
item.description: Tadhg Farrell, who was four, and his 60-year-old great-aunt Mary Holt died in the attack in Edenderry.

item.title: 'Superiority' concerns over Royal Yacht Britannia visit to Ireland
item.description: A possible three-day trip to Ireland by the then Prince of Wales, now King Charles III, was cancelled over security concerns.

item.title: Boy, 16, dies in tractor crash
item.description: The teenager was the sole occupant of the tractor which crashed on Saturday in County Clare.

item.title: Irish citizen detained in US freed after husband appeals to Congress
item.description: Donna Hughes-Brown has reunited with her family after five months in an immigration detention unit in Kentucky.

item.title: Man jailed over €6m drugs seizure
item.description: Padraig Casey has been found guilty of five counts relating to the seizure of cannabis and cocaine in June 2020.

item.title: 'They look hideous' - Battle over the Irish flag on Dublin streets
item.description: Irish tricolour flags have been erected on street lights all over Dublin in recent months in what has been branded by some as an anti-immigration campaign.
